result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul J. Schmeiser

records.addlTxt: 2:02 PM Defendant Paul J. Schmeiser in court.  Attorney Peter J. Prusinski in court for Paul J. Schmeiser.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has been complied. Jury trial is set for July 24-28th. Statement made by Attorney Tlusty. Statement by Attorney Prusinski. Attorney's are to have their list of experts and witnesses by February 28, 2023. Final Pretrial scheduled for June 19, 2023 at 1:00PM.-JN
Jury trial on July 24, 2023 at 08:30 am.

01:15 PM Defendant Paul J. Schmeiser in court with attorney Peter J. Prusinski.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim notification has been complied.   Written waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  Court questions defendant.  Court finds defendant freely and voluntarily waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a crime was committed and binds defendant over for trial.  Information filed.  Waive reading of Information.  Plea of not guilty to the charges.  Status hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 3:00 pm. - rt
Status hearing on April 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

01:05 PM Defendant Paul J. Schmeiser in court with attorney Peter J. Prusinski.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim notification has been complied.  Waived further reading of complaint, charges and penalties.  Preliminary hearing requested with time limits waived freely and voluntarily.   Bond continued.  Citation 22TR22 and 22TR23 are tracking with this case.  Waiver of preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 1:15 pm  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 10:30 am. - rt

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.
Initial Appearance set February 15, 2022 at 1:00 p.m.
Taylor County Arrest Report

3:15 pm.  Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter Prusinski appeared for Paul Schmeiser.  Paul J. Schmeiser appeared in person, in custody.  Victim notification complied.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty is requesting a $2,000.00 cash bond and $18,000.00 signature bond; booking; no possession or consumption of alcohol.  Statement by Attorney Prusinski.  Court orders bond as requested by Attorney Tlusty.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 1:00 pm.  - rt
